text: I'm Jason whiner and I'm the director of
Arthur the scene that you see these
images from is a scene where Arthur
surprises Naomi the tour guide played by
Greta Gerwig with the fact that he has
emptied out Grand Central and he set up
a little table he's surrounded with it
with rose petals and later in the scene
he surprises her with the fact that
there's acrobats actually jumping on
trampolines on the mezzanine so how did
we shoot the scene well we actually did
empty out Grand Central Station we we
shot it's not it's not digital in any
way you know we got permission to shoot
when the station is naturally empty
which is for exactly an hour and a half
between 3:00 a.m. and 4:30 a.m. in the
morning in order to shoot a scene that
big that quickly we brought in all our
lighting equipment and all the cameras
and the actors and rehearsed while
commuters were still streaming through
the station so everybody was taking
pictures wondering what we were up to
and we did that for four hours until we
were ready to shoot and the second the
station was ours at 3:00 a.m. we shot
and we did what we call cross coverage
where cameras are rolling on both sides
of the seam scene at the same time it's
very complex for the DP to light for a
scene where you're looking at both sides
and and looking sort of every direction
at once but that was the only way to
accomplish the scene that quickly so
when you when you watch the scene in the
movie and you feel that like Russell's
character and Greta's character really
sort of connecting and playing off of
each other they are because the two
cameras are rolling at the same time on
both of them
